meanings.definition: To reduce the official value of a currency in relation to other currencies.
meanings.sent1: The government is devaluating our money, making it worth less.
meanings.sent2: Countries sometimes devaluate their currency to boost exports.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my piggy bank was devaluating faster than I could save.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was devaluating like a sinking ship in stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick devaluating the coin left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To diminish the worth or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism can devaluate a person's self-esteem over time.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments started to devaluate the value of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The gossip about her devaluating the party spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions devaluate the efforts of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The rainstorm seemed to devaluate the beauty of the garden, washing away its charm.
